COMPUTATIONAL SCIENTIST: PRODUCTION ANALYSIS

About us

Founded in 2008, Cofactor Genomics is a biotechnology company pioneering the use of RNA to diagnose disease. The company’s novel technology combines biology with proprietary machine learning software to develop unique molecular diagnostics centered on RNA. Cofactor Genomics was founded by three former Human Genome Project molecular and computational scientists and is dual headquartered in St. Louis, MO and San Francisco, CA.

To date, Cofactor Genomics has raised more than $20 million in funding, including an oversubscribed $18 million Series A in 2017. The company is backed by several top-tier investors including Menlo Ventures, Data Collective, Y Combinator, Ascension Ventures, Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati, and Stanford University, among others. Cofactor has been featured in many publications, including TechCrunch and Wired Magazine.

About the position

Cofactor Genomics is looking for an individual to join our analysis team full-time and help support our next-generation sequencing operations. Previous experiences in bioinformatics or computational biology are not required for this role, however candidates with this experience will be prioritized.

You will be responsible for running and maintaining Cofactor’s RNA-sequencing and RNAseqDX (CAP/CLIA-certified) production pipelines. We're looking for someone who learns quickly and is willing to take on challenges even if they're outside their comfort zone. Someone who loves building new features, but cares enough about their code to get the details right. It is not essential to have a background in bioinformatics and computational biology, but you'll need to be able to apply your software engineering skills to those fields. Experience takes precedence to educational background, but we're looking for a minimum of a bachelor's degree up to a master's degree with 3 years experience.

This job will be located in Cofactor's San Francisco office. If you are unwilling or unable to relocate, please do not apply. Thank you!

Reporting to the Chief Scientific Officer, responsibilities include:

Process and deliver analysis of RNA-sequencing data and similar projects, including all QC of data.
Process and deliver analysis for RNAseqDX, Cofactor’s CLIA-compliant RNA-seq product.
Develop new software tools and pipelines as needed (along with tests and documentation) for performing production analysis.
Local and cloud-based database and systems administration and development.
Meet with our clients to understand their needs and help them interpret the results of their analyses.
Understands and able to participate in discussions around gene expression, sequencing including next generation sequencing, genomics research and clinical studies.
Interact and support Production Laboratory Group to achieve strategic goals.


Qualifications

Minimum of a B.S. / B.A. in computer science or bioinformatics is required.
Minimum 3 years of work experience.
Comfort working in a small entrepreneurial environment is a definite asset.
Experience with Python and Bash.
Familiarity with data science libraries such as Pandas.
Experience with Unix systems and command line tools.
Large-scale dataset, SQL, HTML, Javascript, PHP, user interface design and related skills are a plus.


Professional Characteristics

Successful in meeting deadlines while balancing long and short term goals
Supportive and generous in a collaborative engineering culture
Comfortable in a start-up environment and proactively seeking out information as needed


Perks and Benefits

Equity options
401k program with employer contribution
Medical, dental, and vision insurance, and HSA available
Life insurance
Parental Leave
Happy hours and team-wide social events


Sound like a fit?

Regardless of your level of experience, we look for people with high growth potential. We encourage you to apply early. We intend to hire the first person that is a good fit. Cofactor Genomics is an equal opportunity employer. We look forward to hearing from you!

Exonics is seeking a creative, self-motivated individual to work on cutting edge science and take part in discovering and developing the next generation of genetic therapies for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy and other neuromuscular disorders.

Position Details

Position Information

Recruitment/Posting Title Postdoctoral Associate

Department CABM

Salary Commensurate With Experience

Posting Summary
CABM, the Center for Advanced Biotechnology and Medicine, invites applications for a postdoctoral position associated with the center.

The Postdoctoral Associate will conduct computational NMR research, including protein structure modeling using combined NMR and bioinformatics data. This is a grant funded position on an NIH-funded research project which involves development of new computational methods for modeling membrane protein structures using NMR data. The successful candidate will participate in projects using energy force fields, molecular dynamics, and novel conformational sampling techniques, combining NMR, SAXS, bioinformatics, and other experimental data to produce structural models of membrane proteins. Goals include determining 3D structures of membrane proteins from sparse NMR data, and characterizing their internal dynamics. The successful candidate will also lead our efforts to develop tools for validating the accuracy of protein structure models determined from NMR data.

Qualifications

Minimum Education and Experience
Candidates should have a Ph.D. in Computational Molecular Biology, Biophysical Chemistry, Molecular Biophysics, or a related discipline.

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Experience in developing algorithms and computer software for structural biology and bioinformatics projects is desired. The applicant must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and must be able to effectively communicate science in writing and through oral presentations.

Laboratory environment.

This position requires design of scientific approach and of experiments, under the direction of the Principal Investigator (PI). Responsible for assisting the PI to plan and develop research strategies that will fulfill the goals of the grant. Will also assist in developing future research directions and in applying for future research funding.

Bioinformatic Scientist- Professional Services

Job Description:
DNAnexus combines expertise in cloud computing and bioinformatics to create the global network for genomics, operating in North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific (including China), South America, and Africa. The secure, scalable, and collaborative cloud-based DNAnexus Platform helps thousands of researchers across a spectrum of industries – biopharmaceutical, bioagricultural, sequencing services, clinical diagnostics, government, and research consortia – accelerate their genomics programs globally.

This is an exciting opportunity to join DNAnexus' growing Science team. We are looking for a bioinformatician familiar with genomics data analysis who enjoys working hands-on with other scientists, software engineers, and customers to solve informatics challenges. As a member of the Bioinformatics team in the DNAnexus Professional Services organization, you will work with industry leaders across all aspects of genomics, gaining exposure to leading genomic science and application development. You will develop and integrate bioinformatics pipelines, data standards, methods, and datasets into the DNAnexus platform and advise customers on bioinformatic best-practices,. You'll be the scientific and technical liaison between DNAnexus and some of the highest-profile pharmaceutical and clinical diagnostic companies, helping them to fully leverage DNAnexus products and services to achieve their scientific objectives.

Responsibilities


Research, integrate, and test new bioinformatics methods on the DNAnexus Platform
Design data standards and integrate normalized genomics datasets in our platform
Introduce DNAnexus to prospective customers and demonstrate how we can help them migrate to the cloud
Teach new customers how to use our platform and use the SDK to develop their own genomic workflows
Work directly with customers to assess their scientific and bioinformatics needs and creatively propose solutions to meet or exceed these needs
Advance our relationships with scientific and technical users, achieve customer satisfaction objectives, and grow our active user base
Synthesize knowledge gained during customer interactions to help direct our technology development roadmap
Develop scientific use cases, presentations, and marketing material for customer visits

Requirements


Masters, or equivalent experience, in computer science, bioinformatics, computational biology, biology, genetics, or related discipline with a computational emphasis. A PhD is desirable.
Strong programming ability in relevant languages such as Python, Perl or shell scripting
Hands-on experience with genomics sequence analysis, for example using popular tools such as BWA and GATK
Excellent analytical, problem solving, and interpersonal skills
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Experience working collaboratively with bioinformatics scientists
Experience with NGS technology and pipelines a plus
Enjoys interacting closely with DNAnexus customers
Available for occasional travel (~10%) to conferences and to customer sites

Desirable skills

Below are the skills that are highly desirable, but are not required. DNAnexus will provide the necessary training to qualified candidates:


Understanding of cloud computing and high performance computing
Understanding of GxP
Experience integrating and harmonizing genotypic and phenotypic data
Ability to create visual dashboards to increase the comprehension of complex data using data visualization tools such as Looker

Based in Mountain View, California, DNAnexus is experiencing rapid growth and is searching for the best talent to join our team. Key investors include Google Ventures, Microsoft, and Foresite Capital.

Clinical Informaticist Clinical Services Lab, LLC
EDUCATION AND REQUIRED SKILLS EXPERIENCE
Education and Experience:
Bachelors degree in clinical informatics, bioinformatics, computational biology, biostatistics, computer science or related quantitative field; graduate degree a plus
Knowledge of current bioinformatics approaches, databases, information system with an emphasis on large-scale data sets.
Excellent programming skills
Strong understanding of statistics and next generation sequencing data generation and analysis, as demonstrated through previous work or academic experience
Experience with human genetics, next generation sequencing data, molecular diagnostics, or health informatics is an asset.
Required Skills:
Excellent communication skills, demonstrating ability to understand objectives of clinical laboratory, regulatory and compliance topics.
Meticulous attention to detail
JOB SPECIFIC TASKS
The clinical informaticist will use bioinformatics and informatics technology in order to develop and maintain systems for a molecular diagnostics lab that performs next generation sequencing. This requires an appreciation of regulatory and compliance considerations as well as a desire to bring innovation and ingenuity to the challenge of working within that framework.
The clinical informaticist will:Participate in data processing and quality control, including development of tools to facilitate process improvementWork with the lab information management systemContribute to the quality management and compliance programs, ensuring that lab processes comply with evolving standards.
Write standard operating procedures and manuals as needed.Develop tools to process and analyze data in an accurate and reproducible way.Perform data mining and analysis as required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS
The physical requirements and environmental conditions of this position consist primarily of:
Continuous mental and visual attention, requiring sustained attention and observation
Ability to work at a PC monitor for most of the work day

Performance of general molecular biological methods including DNA isolation, real-time PCR, DNA cloning, qPCR and NGS assay development and validation.
Ability to conduct experiments independently and with minimal supervision. Analysis of experimental results and independent decision-making with guidance regarding experimental design.
Work in a highly collaborative manner.
Outstanding personal initiative and communication skills (oral and written English).
Train group members.
With guidance from the PIs, produce scientific manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals, and present research data in house and in scientific conferences. Write as well as assist in the preparation of applications for external grants for research and fellowships.
Experience working with next generation sequencing sample preparation is highly desirable. Experience in NGS data analysis/bioinformatics is a plus. Excellent knowledge of English language is a plus.

Job Description
EDIT
Sema4 is searching for a Somatic Curator for Next-generation sequencing applications are essential diagnostic tests for Personalized Medicine and generate large amounts of variants which that require significant effort towards accurately identifying, classifying and interpreting variants detected through standard clinical genetic testing. The Somatic Variant Curation Scientist will play a key role in the clinical operations of the testing laboratory.
Using information from existing case evidence, the curator will help determine pathogenicity of variants. Such clinical interpretation is a critical component for the reporting of molecular genetic testing results.
Position Description:
Interprets and classify genetic variants identified by clinical testing as well as interfacing with Clinical Genetics Services (CGS) for pre- and post-sign out issues, including variant assessment and curation.
Investigates the clinical significance of gene variants found in sequencing-based assays by searching online mutation databases as well as published literature or other resources.
Prepares variant assessment summaries, maintains an internal variant database for different disease/assay areas for the curation.
Interacts with all aspects of clinical workflow and supporting groups.
Additional translational clinical developmental activities will be required.
Remote position is a possibility
Position Requirements/Preferences
PhD in Life Science such as Molecular Biology/Genetics or Genetic Counseling required
Experience in analyzing and assessing variants and mutations in cancer samples from myeloid and solid tumors
Experience in analyzing and assessing germline variants a plus
A strong background in Human Genetics and an in-depth understanding of biology, molecular mechanisms and functional studies is essential.
Must possess strong ability to critically read, understand and interpret data from scientific publications. Cross-disciplinary and strong analytical skills as well as experience with databases, software and bioinformatic tools preferred.
Familiarity with clinically relevant variant and population databases, Sanger sequencing and Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) experience is preferred
Direct experience with aspects of clinical oncology preferred
Record of success in problem solving as demonstrated by high quality publications
Experience with meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Experience with projects related to personalized medicine

Cibus is a biotechnology company with advanced technologies to precisely target and direct a plant’s natural gene-editing processes. This approach accelerates natural plant breeding that has been a staple of farming for thousands of years and has resulted in a rapid, versatile and low-cost way to improve nutrition, increase crop yields, and reducing waste.
The company has a worldwide presence, with subsidiaries in Europe and North America and a state-of-the-art research and development center in San Diego. job_description: $88,582 - $115,157 a yearPlease note that US citizenship is required for this job.The VA Cooperative Studies Program Coordinating Center (CSPCC) is seeking a full-time Data Scientist. The VA Palo Alto CSPCC is one of the five CSPCCs located at VA medical centers across the country. The VA Palo Alto CSPCC has biostatisticians, epidemiologists, statistical programmers, data scientists, clinical data managers and project managers. About the New York Genome Center

The New York Genome Center (NYGC) is an independent, nonprofit academic research institution at the forefront of transforming biomedical research with the mission of advancing clinical care. A collaboration of premier academic, medical and industry leaders across the globe, the New York Genome Center is committed to advancing genomic research and offering clinical genomic testing so that new treatments, therapies and therapeutics against human disease can be developed. NYGC member organizations and partners are united in this unprecedented collaboration of technology, science and medicine, designed to harness the power of innovation and discoveries to advance genomic services.

The New York Genome Center is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, creed, color, gender, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, disability, genetic predisposition or carrier status, protected veteran or military status, domestic violence victim status, partnership status, caregiver status, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. The New York Genome Center takes affirmative action in support of its policy to hire and advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Position Description

The Knowles lab (https://daklab.github.io/) will be opening in January 2019 at the New York Genome Center, jointly with Columbia University. We aim to understand the role of transcriptomic dysregulation across the spectrum from rare to common genetic disease. This involves better characterization of the genetic and environmental factors contributing to gene expression and splicing variation. A postdoctoral position is available in molecular genetics and functional genomics. Potential projects will involve Cas13-based forward genetic screens and single-cell/long-read transcriptomics. There is great opportunity for close collaboration with research groups at NYGC with deep expertise developing these approaches.

This position would be ideally suited to a candidate who has a proven ability to drive wet lab projects but who aspires to develop their computational and bioinformatic (“dry”) skillset.

Postdoctoral researchers will have the opportunity to develop an independent research program. All lab members will have the option of being cross-trained in both computational analysis and experimental work, and will be eligible for an appointment at Columbia University in Systems Biology.

Please include the following items with your application: 1) CV with a list of publications; 2) a short summary of your present and future research interests; 3) a list of 2-3 references with contact information. If you’re attending ASHG it would be great to chat with you there!

job_title: BIOMEDICAL SOFTWARE DEVELOPER - GENETICS & GEOMIC SCIENCES

job_description:
Part-timeDuPont has a rich history of scientific discovery that has enabled countless innovations and today, we're looking for more people, in more places, to collaborate with us to make life the best that it can be.
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and talented microbiologist to join our dynamic and collaborative team to support company goals in probiotic and human nutrition science. The successful candidate will be part of the Genomics and Microbiome Sciences Group with primary focus to characterize probiotic strains and microbiome communities through cultivation and molecular methods. This position will be within the DuPont Nutrition and Health division and will work cross-functionally with technical teams involved in upstream research, applications and manufacturing.

The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting probiotic research efforts including culturing bacteria, strain screening, genome sequencing, and microbiome community profiling. This role requires microbial cultivation skills and experience with next-generation sequencing methods. This is an exciting opportunity for candidates with a microbiology background who want to be a part of developing commercial probiotics to restore and maintain health.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Conducts research through the application of microbiological and molecular biology methods and approaches in support of business directed probiotic projects.
Prepares growth media and cultivates microorganisms using aseptic techniques.
Extracts nucleic acids, performs PCR/dPCR, and prepares sequencing libraries from bacterial cultures and human microbiome samples.
Analyzes NGS data, including: genomic, amplicon, and transcriptomic data sets.
Performs high throughput in vitro screening of strains using standard and novel assays
Maintains and manages culture collections.
Operates and maintains laboratory anaerobic chambers and biological safety cabinets.
Maintains thorough documentation of experimental plans, process workflows, and results.
Prepares results for presentation, inclusion in technical reports, and for publication in peer-reviewed scientific journals.
Stays current in microbiome research and development by keeping up with relevant literature and attending scientific meetings.





SCOPE OF POSITION

The incumbent will be a member of the Madison-based R&D group, specifically the Genomics and Microbiome Sciences Group. In this role, they will be expected to conduct research as part of multifunctional project teams, based on specific business goals as set by the Health & Protection leadership. As needed, the individual will be expected to lead projects and help develop project plans. Direction will come from the Genomics and Microbiome Sciences Group manager. Research activities and responsibilities will be integrated into the overall global Technology as part of Health & Protection within Nutrition and Health.

The main objective is to characterize qualities of DuPont bacterial strains to further understandings of probiotic health benefits, probiotic strain safety and diversity, and probiotic mode-of-action. It is expected that the incumbent will master specific technical skills commensurate with modern microbiology that include cultivation and bioinformatic analysis sufficiently to independently perform such work and instruct others as well.

It is expected that the incumbent will perform their research in accordance with sound scientific principles, endeavor to maintain a current level of expertise in the area of microbiology and foster an attitude of innovation and creativity. Additionally, it is expected that the incumbent will develop sufficient understanding to relate basic and applied research activities towards business goals and directives. The work and environment is considered multi-disciplinary requiring excellent technical, communication and people skills. Emphasis is placed upon the ability to constantly learn, improve, and apply new knowledge towards the research and business objectives. The incumbent will be afforded every opportunity to expand their skill level and further develop their career.

WORK CONDITIONS

Operates in an office / laboratory environment. Full time, 40-hr per week. Some travel expected.

GENERAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Independently conduct experimental work as defined by project objectives.
Ensure continuing project activity by coordinating the resources, supplies, equipment and priority for each project.
Ensure that experimental results are routinely recorded in a lab notebook. Updated written and/or oral reports to potential customers and to management and upon the completion of the project.
Keep up to date on new trends, technical developments and skills by monitoring the scientific and trade literature, competitors’ activities, new methods and processes for food ingredients in associated areas though continuing education and/or technical seminars.
Represent R&D as a scientific expert and resource for internal and external customers, conducting training presentations, answering technical questions.
Ensure that work areas are kept clean and meet GMP guidelines.
Regular attendance is an essential function of this position.
Compliance with applicable company policies concerning maintaining a drug free work place is required.


Job Qualifications

Trained in Microbiology, Genetics, Molecular Biology, Computer Science or related field with an emphasis in microbial bioinformatics and microbial ecology.
Position requires a min of 5 yrs experience with a PhD designation, 7+ yrs with MSc and/or 10+ yrs w/BSc of relevant experience
Extensive experience analyzing and interpreting microbial amplicon, genomic, transcriptomic, or metabolomic datasets from clinical studies, environmental samples, or other mixed/mono populations. Includes modeling and correcting raw sequencing data.
Demonstrated experience constructing and visualizing microbial networks via dissimilarity, correlation, and regression methods as well as Bayesian or Markov models (e.g. CoNet, ReBoot, Cytoscape)
Basic knowledge and experience with integrative algorithms for module extraction and comparison (e.g. COBRA, HotNet, NetworkBLAST)
Knowledge of machine learning frameworks and their application to NGS datasets.
Proficiency in UNIX/Linux development environment and relevant programming languages (e.g. R, Matlab, Python, Perl). Experience with HPC clusters and revision control is desirable.
Familiarity with large public and private sequence databases (e.g. KEGG, BioCyc, Pfam).
Strong publication record.
Demonstrated ability to independently design, manage, and perform multi-task projects to a successful result.
Must be a team player and a focused individual with a strong work ethic and great attention to detail.
Experience in project management; planning, tracking and reporting, desirable.
Possess excellent oral and written communication skills for presentation of scientific concepts and results to internal and external customers.
Compliance with all company policies is required.
Other functions as required (non-essential functions).
Responsible for adherence to all quality systems including, ISO 9002 and Food Safety, with an understanding of DuPont Quality Policy and procedures


About DowDuPont
DowDuPont (NYSE: DWDP) is a holding company comprised of The Dow Chemical Company and DuPont with the intent to form strong, independent, publicly traded companies in agriculture, materials science and specialty products sectors that will lead their respective industries through productive, science-based innovation to meet the needs of customers and help solve global challenges. For more information, please visit us at www.dow-dupont.com.


The positions represented by this job posting are aligned to one of the three divisions, Agriculture, Materials Science or Specialty Products, which are expected to separate from DowDuPont into stand-alone public companies. Information on the division alignment will be provided during the recruitment process.

We believe that everyone benefits from their biological information. It is our mission to empower every person to improve their life through DNA. With our high-quality, trusted partners and state-of-the-art lab, we have created the first platform of personalized products and services powered by genetics. From inherited cancer screening to custom fitness and nutrition plans, the world of DNA learning is becoming more accessible and more valuable than ever.

So far we have raised over $300 million from investors like Illumina (the world's leader in genetic sequencing equipment), Warburg Pincus, Sutter Hill Ventures, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers and Draper Fisher Jurvetson Growth. Our app store and marketplace include partners such as National Geographic, Admera Health, Vinome and many others, with whom we have partnered to develop applications which interpret your genome.

Our big vision comes with big responsibility. That's why we're building a team of experts in the field of genetics, engineering, design, business development, and beyond to help bring actionable insights to our customers. We're looking for the best and brightest minds who are passionate about our mission and are excited to work with a truly diverse team.

We are looking for a bioinformatics scientist to join our Partner Science team. The successful candidate will work with our partners to build safe, accurate and insightful products that benefit all Helix users. You will help them integrate and parse the genomic data coming from Helix by reviewing their product and by contributing to our SDK. You will work cross-functionally with our science, bioinformatics R&D, and engineering teams to develop new analytical capabilities toward democratizing access to genomic information. For example, you could create a service to test the applicability of a polygenic risk score across populations with different ancestries. Above all, you have an insatiable curiosity, entrepreneurial spirit, enjoy teamwork, and are excited about the potential of combining exome data with the expertise of all our partners.

As a Bioinformatics Scientist, you will:

Review and test products on the Helix platform
Onboard partners and help them integrate with our genomic APIs. Create solutions that scale as the number of partners using Helix genomic data increases
Work closely with our bioinformatics team to prototype new analytical capabilities (allelic dosage, risk score distribution across ancestries)
Use Helix dataset as well as public datasets like UKBB to create and replicate genetic risk scores
Communicate about the science at Helix

Required background:

Ph.D. in bioinformatics or a related field (genetics, computer science, etc), or an MS + 3 years of experience in the industry
Experience with human NGS (exome/genome preferred) sequence analysis
Experience analyzing and manipulating large datasets in Python (preferred), R.
Strong communication skills, both oral and written.
Entrepreneurial spirit; willing to contribute in multiple areas; curious and independently motivated
Problem-focused and able to drive tasks to completion
Able to travel at least once per quarter

The ideal candidate will have:

Experience with outside collaborations
Ability to explain complicated topics to lay audience (blogging or public lectures)
Experience with GitHub, AWS, etc.
Code documentation intended for general audience readability and use
Experience analyzing large-scale datasets such as the UKBiobank

What Helix has to offer you

Aside from working alongside brilliant, dedicated, passionate, down-to-earth, curious, warm, and thoughtful people, we also provide great benefits:


Competitive compensation, including meaningful equity
Health insurance, including medical, dental, and vision
12 weeks of Maternity or Paternity leave
4 weeks of paid Pregnancy Disability
401(k) with employer matching
On-premise nursing room
Corporate fitness rate
Commuter benefits
Catered meals
Flexible PTO

Comprising diverse researchers from a variety of disciplines across academic divisions, the UC Santa Cruz Genomics Institute leads UC Santa Cruz's efforts to unlock the world's genomic data and accelerate breakthroughs in health and evolutionary biology. Our platforms, technologies, and scientists unite global communities to create and deploy data-driven, life-saving treatments and innovative environmental and conservation efforts.

This position will collaborate with external research laboratories to import biomedical data into the databases and web pages maintained by UCSC team for display, access and analysis. Works closely with biomedical lab personnel to reformat data from lab spreadsheets and databases into formats used for loading databases, accurately capture and document experimental results and methods, educate biomedical labs on metadata standards, assist labs in data and metadata submission, and track the flow of data within the UCSC pipeline. Works with internal software developers and database testing staff to ensure data integrity and make the data accessible to the scientific community through web-based access to public and proprietary databases.Applies data / information management concepts, department / unit and campus / medical center / OP methodologies, policies and procedures to resolve a variety of data / information management issues. Works on data / information management problems of moderate scope and complexity where analyses of situations or data require a review of a variety of factors.

Qualifications / Competencies

Bachelor's degree in biological science, computational/programming, or related area and / or equivalent experience / training.

Basic experience either in a biomedical lab or with use of genomic sequencing machinery.

Basic knowledge of modern biology and an applicable field of research.Knowledge of data management systems, practices and standards.

Experience using bioinformatics methods and data structures.

Basic knowledge of and experience with databases.

Demonstrated experience in working with large data sets and spreadsheets.

Basic project management skills.

Interpersonal skills sufficient to work effectively and diplomatically with both internal and external technical and non-technical personnel at various levels.

Ability to communicate technical information and scientific concepts in a clear and concise manner in English.

Ability to self-motivate, learn quickly, meet deadlines and solve problems.

Preferred Qualifications / Competencies

Basic knowledge of applications programming, scripting and web development in a UNIX environment.

Position Summary

We are seeking Bioinformatics Scientist to join an exciting, fast-growing, and well-financed new company to develop novel gene editing therapies for serious diseases. The successful candidates will be integral in discovering and developing the next generation of gene therapies. The successful candidates will have significant expertise in computer science, familiarity with digital datatypes in genetics, experience in programming, design and implementation of big-data, massively parallel algorithms in healthcare informatics and bioinformatics. The position requires enthusiasm, passion, attention to detail, and a desire to create important new medicines for patients.
Responsibilities

Participate in research and development of bioinformatics algorithms in order to facilitate analysis of clinical and genetic information to aid in discovery of gene editing targets for novel immuno-oncology and regenerative medicine therapeutics using CRISPR-based gene editing tools
Participate in design of experimental setup to collect relevant data, and aid in data aggregation, validation, quality control, parsing, analysis, interpretation, and presentation of results
Minimum Qualifications

MS in life sciences or in computer science with +4 years of relevant research and development experience in relevant industry or academia
Extensive knowledge in object-oriented software design concepts in C/C++, fundamental algorithmic approaches, data containers, C runtime libraries, OS architecture, Linux, shell scripting, communication protocols
Knowledge of Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) datatypes, essential algorithms in alignment, variant calling, differential profiling, assembly concepts
Proficient in parallel algorithm development, optimization of big-data aware software.
Proficiency in C/C++, Javascript, Python, make, gcc, bash, awk
Scientifically rigorous, highly organized, and with significant attention to detail
Ability to work independently as well as collaborate with peers and effectively work in a results-oriented research team environment
Strong oral and written communication skills
Preferred Qualifications

Experience in working with regulatory research data analysis platform High-performance Integrated Virtual Environment (HIVE)
Familiarity with full stack development concepts in enterprise software/hardware architecture systems
Familiarity with web-app development, D3 concepts, queuing systems
Experience in working with healthcare or biomedical IT relevant organizations.
Experience in life sciences, including biology, chemistry, physics.
Competencies

Collaborative – Openness, One Team
Undaunted – Fearless, Can-do attitude
Results Orientation – Delivering progress toward our mission. Sense of urgency in solving problems.
Entrepreneurial Spirit – Proactive. Ownership mindset.

Location: Boston, US
Salary: Competitive salary and excellent benefits package. Relocation support available (if required)

Imagine turning your passion for Data Science, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence into insights, predictions and actions that could help develop medicines that change lives. Pushing the frontiers of innovation. Collaborating with some of the finest minds in their fields. Working in an environment that stimulates your curiosity, and enables you to develop your expertise and reach your potential.

AstraZeneca is a global, science led biopharmaceutical business and our innovative medicines are used by millions of patients worldwide. Artificial Intelligence (AI), including deep learning (computer algorithms inspired by biological neural networks), is revolutionising all stages of drug discovery and development from drug design to pivotal clinical trials and beyond. At AstraZeneca, we are deploying AI across the drug discovery phases to discover new connections between data, provide novel insights, accelerate scientific understanding, and increase productivity. For example, we are using AI to help design and synthesise new drug molecules, analyse and interpret the vast amount of data from imaging studies, and for biomarker research to match the right drug to the right patient. In our clinical trials, AI is also enabling us to continuously monitor incoming safety data and alert our scientists to safety signals that need attention.

As a Data Scientist and AI Graduate you will help our scientists make their data ‘AI-ready’, and integrate the latest AI advances into all our drug development programmes. Together we will harness the power of our data and AI to deliver life-changing medicines to patients worldwide.

What does the programme involve?

Your two-year programme begins with an introduction to drug discovery, and how we harness the potential of Data Science, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. You’ll then select two eight-month placements where you’ll apply your developing skills and experience to help us overcome challenges in some of our active research projects. Your placements will help you develop your technical skills and industry knowledge, and on our Global Graduate Development Programme you’ll develop the interpersonal and business skills that will set you up for success.Throughout the programme you’ll work alongside our experts, and take advantage of our close collaborations with leading international academic institutions and organisations to deliver work with real impact.

Placements could involve…
Applying the latest techniques in machine learning and artificial intelligence to preclinical data from drug projects to help detect and understand safety risks and guide the development of new medicines. Exciting work which could also help us refine, reduce and replace animal experiments.
Combining innovative de novo molecule design methodologies utilizing state-of-the-art artificial intelligent technologies with chemistry automation to design novel molecules of therapeutic interest.
Working with our Quantitative Clinical Pharmacology Team to optimize clinical development programs using Bayesian statistic and machine learning modelling.
Developing Bayesian machine learning models for predicting the mechanism and probability of drug toxicity in liver, heart, and other organs. Incorporating existing knowledge of causal relationships and toxicity mechanisms into the prediction problem, and applying Bayesian models to account for uncertainty to improve predictions.
Contributing to challenging projects using advanced Machine Learning models to improve drug discovery by generating testable hypotheses about targets, predicting compound properties, automating complex decision-making processes, and turning data into knowledge.
Applying Artificial Intelligence to integrated electronic health records and genomic data to redefine cancers and help improve patient outcomes.
Working with our Data & Analytics Team to identify, assess and recommend the most innovative external partners, and high impact AI technologies. Writing algorithms to support next generation natural language processing, and optimising code to enable powerful predictive models to be used across AstraZeneca.
As a Data Sciences and AI Graduate you’ll discover how we’re pioneering more open innovation, and actively sharing knowledge and ideas to make the next scientific breakthrough.

Essential Qualification and Skills required:
Highly numerate with a strong Maths, Physics, Statistics or Computer Science focused Bachelors or Masters level qualification gained in 2018 or 2019
A postgraduate qualification in Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computational Biology, Computational Chemistry, Bioinformatics or Cheminformatics would be advantageous, but is not essential.
Innovative thinking, with enthusiasm, energy and drive.
Open-minded, and ready to embrace new ideas and different perspectives.
Strong critical thinking, planning, organisational and time management skills.
Ability to work as part of a collaborative team that focuses unequivocally on patient needs.
AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law.

Please note that our Assessment Centres will be in Boston on 21st March 2019

Applications open: 8th October 2018
Applications close: 20th January 2019

You will join a team of bioinformatics scientists and software engineers whose mission is to develop robust, high performance clinical analysis pipelines that can accurately and reliably analyze large volumes of data coming primarily from next generation sequencing instrumentation, automate data and reporting workflows, and provide reporting tools to health care practitioners and laboratory scientists.

Participate in the resolution of operations support requests where NGS analysis pipelines are involved

Proficient in multiple modern programming languages including Python, Perl and shell scripting
Knowledge of R preferred
Experience with developing container workflows for genomic data analysis

Proven ability to make high-level design choices and developing technical standards, including software coding standards, tools, and platforms in a regulated production environment

Experience working within a cross-functional team of scientists, architects, software and database engineers
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Are you motivated to participate in a dynamic, multi-tasking environment? Do you want to become part of a company that invests in its employees? Are you seeking a position where you can use your skills while continuing to be challenged and learn? Then we encourage you to dive deeper into this opportunity.
NeoGenomics is looking for a Bioinformatics Research Scientist within our Molecular Laboratory who will report directly to the technical director of the Molecular Laboratory. This position is primarily a genomics analyst based position and will assist R&D in developing advanced NGS pipelines for targeted cancer therapy to prepare CAP, CLIA, NCI-Match, NYS, FDA applications/submissions. The person will also be responsible for developing bioinformatic pipelines and custom analysis for validation/troubleshooting of assays required for preliminary for prospective clinical trials as well as maintaining local shared NGS cluster resources.
Now that you know what we're looking for in talent, let us tell you why you'd want to work at NeoGenomics:
NeoGenomics Laboratories is comprised of a national team of experts in developing and delivering laboratory diagnostic and clinical trial services with a focus in cancer. It is the common purpose of all NeoGenomics employees to save lives by improving patient CARE through Communication, Accuracy, Reliability, and Efficiency. Our staff physicians, scientists, laboratory professionals, client services representatives, and sales people team up with our clients. Together, we work to solve the medical, scientific, and logistical challenges of making precise diagnoses, aiding in bringing new therapies to market and finding the unusual hallmarks of each patient’s disease that point the way to proper treatment.
As an employer, we promise to provide you with a purpose driven mission in which you have the opportunity to save lives by improving patient care through the exceptional work you perform. Together, we will become the world's leading cancer reference laboratory.
Position Summary:
As a Bioinformatics Research Scientist you will support the dynamic goals of the fast paced genomics environment in industry. Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to the following:
Lead the Development, analytical testing and validation of new bioinformatic pipelines to improve Neogenomics clinical diagnostic NGS platform with an emphasis on rigorously validation and robust procedures. Working closely with an interdisciplinary team of clinical laboratory scientists, pathologists, R&D scientists, marketing, and sales teams to bring new methods to the operational level.
Assist with drafting and completing government applications (NIH, FDA, NYS, CLIA, CAP) and manuscripts for publication; lead data analysis and interpretation of study results throughout application/publication process from draft through submission and acceptance.

Present scientific and technical data to colleagues in a clear and cohesive manner.
Work independently and prepare timetables, deliverables, and project schedules.

Required working analysis experience of large genomic datasets (RNAseq profiling, somatic variant analysis, CNV analysis, bioinformatics QC of libraries, TCGA), and use of common bioinformatics tools (TopHat, BWA, GATK, SAMtools, pysam, Picard Tools, Bowtie, edgeR, DESeq, BWA etc…).

Established scientific/technical writing and presentation skills; publication/manuscript/CAP/CLIA/NYS validation, NIH grant experience greatly preferred.
Fluency in English

Part-time, InternshipJob Description
Summary of Internship
The Deep Learning Internship position provides an opportunity for STEM students who are currently enrolling a postgraduate program in computer science, electrical engineering, statistics, or similar, to get hands on experience working with scientists and engineers in a multidisciplinary and fast-paced environment. The intern will apply the state-of-the-art deep learning techniques to solved a complex and unexplored problem for improving the Ion Torrent Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) platform. The position starts in June, paid working 40 hours per week through August. Opportunity exists for this position to continue through the academic year on a part-time basis to allow for class schedules.

Understand the fundamentals on the sequencing technologyExplore the problem and proposal a data-driven solution to tackle the problemDevelop a pipeline that converts the idea from abstract to practiceValidate the pipeline and demonstrate the feasibility of the approach from massive amount of data in real world

Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
Solid backgrounds on machine learning, deep learning, statisticsProficiency in Python, R and/or C++Hands on experiences in deep learning software such as TensorFlow, Keras, MXNetFamiliar with CUDA is a plus

M.S. or PH.D. student in computer science, electrical engineering, bioinformatics, statistics, data science, applied mathematics, or similar disciplineStrong knowledge about modern machine learning techniques and expertise in quantitative analysis

**Job Title: ** Computational Bioinformatics Analyst | Imagenetics | Sioux Falls

**City: ** Sioux Falls

**State: ** South Dakota

**Department** **: ** Imagenetics-Sanford Chip

**Job Schedule: ** Full Time

**Shift: ** Days

**Hours Per Shift: ** 8 hr

**JOB SUMMARY**

Provides leadership in computational analysis of or the logical and technical processes necessary for building analyses of phenome, metabolome, glycome, lipidome, infamome, transcriptome, epigenome, and genome, as well as the integration of such with electronic medical record platforms. Possesses proven academic track record of innovation in one or more of these areas. The computational and database systems developed by the application will be used to gather, generate, and track patient data and develop medically actionable hypothesis. Familiarity with security and privacy requirements applicable for working with patient data in a medical environment and in the development of appropriate ethically and legally compliant policies is desirable. establishes data analysis plans for each project, project tracking, outcome monitoring, and manuscript generation. Understands bioinformatics data format, tools, and analytical approaches. Conducts gene pathway analysis. Understands data and where/how it is stored. Writes standard operating procedures (SOPs) for clinical tbest and writes out valid documentation. Programming for analysis of data. Develops computational services, takes CHIP results and runs quality analysis, then generates report to reporting platform to be reviewed and sign off on at the lab. Statistical validation and analysis.

**POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES**

Processes large quantities of detailed information with high levels of accuracy. Develop new software applications or customize existing applications to meet specific scientific project needs. Consult with researchers to analyze problems, recommend technology-based solutions, or determine computational strategies. Compile data for use in activities, such as gene expression profiling, genome annotation, or structural bioinformatics. Design and apply bioinformatics algorithms including unsupervised and supervised machine learning, dynamic programming, or graphic algorithms. Assists in the development of data privacy protection projects. Utilizes privacy standards when sharing, accessing and storing data. Seeks and experiments with new ideas and approaches. Applies data analysis and data modeling techniques to establish, modify, and maintain data structure, and its associated components. Collects required data through various data sources. Analyzes and interprets common statistical data and reports.

**DEPARTMENT DETAILS**

No additional details required at this time.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

If applicants Masters or Ph.D. requires licensure, certification, or registration, this must be achieved or eligibility and timeline for achievement is agreed upon before hire. Masters in Bioinformatics or Biostatistics or a Ph.D. in a related math or science field is required. Experience in bioinformatics or closely related field is required including demonstrated experience in next generation sequence analysis. Experience with electronic medical record (EMR) APIs and interfaces and movement of data out of and into EMRs is desirable. Experience in programming Python, Perl, R, and Java is desirable. Experience with the integration and management of multiple data sources, workflows, and enabling integrated management of and reporting on those data and process through graphical user interfaces is desirable. Preference will be given to those individuals with expertise in genetic and/or epigenetic analyses and medical and/or research informatics experience.

Bioinformatics Research Scientist

The Bioinformatics and Biostatistics Core provides computational and statistical research support to the growing number of scientists dedicated to studying cancer, neurodegenerative disease, and epigenetics at Van Andel Research Institute. We process and analyze next generation sequencing data, aid in experimental design, perform statistical simulations, and more. To ensure quality, expeditious assistance for such diverse requests and responsibilities, we are looking for a full-time Bioinformatics Research Scientist to join our team.

As a Bioinformatics Research Scientist on our team, your first and foremost responsibility will be to work closely with scientists on the design, processing, and analysis of next-generation sequencing studies. But the fun doesn’t stop there. Any given day’s responsibilities might include:
Meeting with a scientist to discuss a grantWrangling data into a useable formatPatiently explaining to a researcher why an experiment failedDevelop, maintain, and support bioinformatics software for VAI research projectsIntegrate primary data and publically available data sets for comprehensive analysis and evaluationAnalyze data through established and novel bioinformatics techniques.Provide experimental design and analysis expertise/timelines to research facultyParticipate in grant and manuscript writing with research facultyDevelop and implement bioinformatics educational materials through seminars and workshopsServe as a co-mentor to interns and graduate students that have a significant bioinformatics component to their research projectWork with the genomics core and faculty to develop novel applications of sequencing technology and subsequent analysisEngage in bioinformatics literature to ensure the availability of robust methods, resources, and data sources to support the user groupsPresent novel bioinformatics analyses and/or methods at scientific conferencesLeading a workshop on how to use R, Python, or the latest bioinformatics analysis toolsBrainstorming with fellow teammates on making the Bioinformatics and Biostatistics Core better

The Van Andel Institute Bioinformatics and Biostatistics Core is an energetic, innovative and diverse group of scientists that are passionate about data analysis. This job might be right for you if:

You are interested in joining a team of professionals dedicated to advancing scientific knowledge. This is an opportunity to leave your mark.

You love taking on difficult challenges and finding the best solution whether it be tried-and-true or cutting edge.

You enjoy helping others. Taking a few moments to explain how sequencing works makes you feel warm and fuzzy. You are patient and levelheaded.

You pay attention to detail. Every analysis, big or small, is worth doing well, every single time so that the results are robust and reproducible.

You are motivated and driven. You take ownership of your projects. You like learning new things and advancing your skillset. If you don’t know the answer, you’ll dig until you find it.

You play well with others. You enjoy collaborating and working as a team. You respect the skills each team member brings to the table while still being willing to provide constructive criticism.

To join our team you will need to have at least:
A Ph.D. in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Molecular Biology, or similar field with demonstrable computational and statistical skillsExperience in NGS data analysis and/or data integration (Required)Understanding of cellular and molecular biology and/or geneticsExperience in R (Required) and at least one other programming/scripting language (i.e. Python, C++, Perl)Advanced mathematical and/or statistical skills as related to the analysis of NGS dataExperience working in a Linux environment (Required)

You must have the ability to contribute independently to experimental design when given a broad research question/problem. You will be expected to actively seek out information on methods and applications or consult with peers. Within 3 months, you will be expected to have met with and developed ongoing relationships with a number of VARI laboratories. as well as developing educational resources and conducting short-courses, workshops, and seminars on NGS and bioinformatics. You will have the opportunity to author publications as well as develop new statistics and bioinformatics analysis tools and/or methods.

APPLY TODAY by submitting an CV and cover letter outlining your interest in this role and how your background aligns with the position description. If you have any difficulty uploading your application or any questions, please email Eric Miller at eric.miller@vai.org.

VAI is actively striving to diversify its workforce and strongly encourages qualified individuals from underrepresented groups to apply. Van Andel Institute is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer

The University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center (UTSW) has recently launched a fully philanthropically funded Department of Bioinformatics with a scientific focus on the integrative computational analysis and modeling of complex biomedical processes in high-dimensional and multi-modal data sets. The program is driven under the premise that bioinformatics in its core is a pattern recognition problem whose solution builds on computational theory and algorithms that are sharable across all biomedical data types and research applications. Accordingly, the Department will have a faculty that tackles fundamental questions in computer science while effectively translating the results into high-impact basic and clinical research. Further information on the vision for the Department and implementation strategies can be found at http://www.utsouthwestern.edu/education/medical-school/departments/bioinformatics/index.html

We invite applications from candidates working in all foundational and translational areas of a broadly defined bioinformatics. Candidates may propose research programs with a significant clinical and/or experimental component; but, successful candidates will distinguish themselves by proposing a disruptive research program that rests on innovation in computational approaches.Appointment rank will be commensurate with academicaccomplishments and experience.Generous startup packages and research space will be available through department resources and/or co-recruitment with other UTSW departments as well as through the Endowed Scholars Program, if applicable: (http://www.utsouthwestern.edu/education/programs/nondegree-programs/other-programs/endowed-scholars/index.html).

To apply: Candidates must have a Ph.D. and should submit a 1-page letter of interest, a NIH-formatted biosketch including the sections Personal Statement and Contributions to Science and followed by a complete list of publications, a 3-page research statement, and three letters of reference.

UT Southwestern Medical Center is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Women, minorities, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Responsibilities
We are currently looking to hire a Bioinformatics Software Engineer. The person in this position will be providing bioinformatics and software support to the world-class biomedical research conducted in the labs Gladstone Institutes. Working closely with experimental scientists, you will perform implementation and pipelining of the bioinformatics processes, methods assessment and result reporting and publication. You will be working with a whole genome sequence data primarily. You will have opportunities for method development, technical writing for grant applications and manuscripts, travel for conferences, meeting presentation and further training to develop your expertise and skill sets.
Qualifications
Expertise and knowledge of state of the art sequencing tools and platforms, to genetics, variant calling, variant annotation, and sequence data manipulation is required.
Experience with family-based sequence analysis and pedigree analysis would be a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or relevant experience. Master’s or PhD degree preferred.
At least one year on related experience
About Gladstone
The Gladstone Institutes is an independent, not-for-profit research institution affiliated with the University of California San Francisco (UCSF), contributing to the health and well-being of all people through medical research, education, and outreach in the areas of heart disease, HIV/AIDS, and neurological disease. Gladstone is composed of three separate institutes and approximately 400 employees. Our employees receive exceptional benefits. We are located in an award-winning building adjacent to UCSF's Mission Bay Campus. Gladstone has consistently ranked as one of the top places to work in academia in the United States.

Our mission is to make biology easier to engineer. Ginkgo is constructing, editing, and redesigning the living world in order to answer the globe’s growing challenges in health, energy, food, materials, and more. Our bioengineers make use of an in-house automated foundry for designing and building new organisms. Today, our foundry is developing over 40 different organisms to make different products across multiple industries.

We're making the code base, compiler, and debugger for life. We're looking for Software Engineers specializing in bioinformatics who are interested in developing the organism design toolchain - the CAD, CAM, and CAT tools that will define how bioengineers design organisms at scale.
Ginkgo's programming languages of choice are Ruby, Python, Javascript/HTML, and DNA, but you must be someone who loves writing elegant code in any language. Most importantly, you should be passionate about making biology the next engineering discipline. The 20th century was all about bits and the awesome technology of computers. The 21st century is all about atoms and the awesome technology of biology. Ginkgo is at the forefront of this revolution.
Responsibilities
Developing genetic design tools for forward design of enzymes, metabolic pathways, and genomes
Developing tools for comparative and phylogenetic analysis of genome and metagenome sequence data
Developing sequence analysis tools for verification, analysis, and comparison of engineered strains
Developing tools for manipulation and analysis of NGS datasets
Writing custom scripts for any of the above as needed
Integration of tools into Ginkgo's software infrastructure
Requirements
PhD or equivalent in computer science, bioinformatics, computational biology, or equivalent
Experience with manipulation and visualization of genome, metagenome, and/or NGS datasets
Proven ability to write clean, elegant code and contribute to collaborative codebases
To learn more about Ginkgo, check out some recent press:
Ginkgo Bioworks secures $275 million in Series D, valuing the company at over $1 billion (TechCrunch)
Can This Company Convince You to Love GMOs? (The Atlantic)
Hundreds Of Millions Of Dollars Pour Into Hacking Microbes (Forbes)

We also feel it’s important to point out the obvious here – there’s a serious lack of diversity in our industry and it needs to change. Our goal is to help drive that change. We hope to continue to build a company whose culture promotes inclusion and embraces how rewarding it is to work with engineers from all walks of life. Making biology easier to engineer is a tough nut to crack – we can’t afford to leave any talent untapped.

It is the policy of Ginkgo Bioworks to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants.

$47,000 - $60,000 a year (Indeed Est.) Sanford Burnham Prebys Medical Discovery Institute (SBP) is an independent nonprofit research organization that blends cutting-edge fundamental research with robust drug discovery to address unmet clinical needs in the areas of cancer, neuroscience, immunity, and metabolic disorders. The Institute invests in talent, technology, and partnerships to accelerate the translation of laboratory discoveries that will have the greatest impact on patients. Recognized for its world-class NCI-designated Cancer Center and the Conrad Prebys Center for Chemical Genomics, SBP employs about 1,000 scientists and staff in San Diego (La Jolla), Calif., and Orlando (Lake Nona), Fla. For more information, visit us at SBPdiscovery.org. The Institute can also be found on Facebook at facebook.com/SBPdiscovery and on Twitter @SBPdiscovery.

Summary:

We are looking for an early-stage postdoc with a PhD in bioinformatics to join the group of Rolf Bodmer at SBP. The lab is working on the discovery and modeling of genetic pathways involved in heart development and establishment of heart function in the genetic model organism Drosophila, in parallel with a lab working on similar efforts in human iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes, with the aim is to build genetic models of congenital heart disease (CHD), as well as other heart diseases. We are partnered with clinicians and human geneticists to test candidate genes for CHDs to provide tangible evidence for the functional role of these genes and to develop genetic frameworks in which potential CHD genes are embedded.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Developing and automating information and analysis pipelines, data integration, pattern-matching analyses and visualization of a variety of different data sets, including NGS, proteomics etc
Good experience in process and analyzing genomic data and using standard bioinformatics tools and databases.
Supporting of reproducible computational research
Analysis, interpretation and integration of comprehensive, state-of-the-art genome-wide datasets from human as well as various model organisms, and pathway analysis (Cytoscape, IPA)
Data analysis, including scripting, programming, statistical analyses
bioinformatical and programming skills (Python, R, C++, scripting)
Supports projects directed by lab investigators and contributes to the general technical knowledge of researchers

1-2 years of experience after PhD degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, etc. is preferred)

The Division of Infectious Diseases and Immunology at NYU School of Medicine invites applications for tenure track positions at the Assistant and Associate Professor level in the areas of Microbial Immunity, Pathogenesis, or Vaccine Immunology. We seek applicants with M.D., M.D./Ph.D., or Ph.D. degrees and an exceptional record of achievement to join our growing Division. We are particularly interested in candidates studying innate and/or adaptive immune responses to important agents of human infectious diseases.

New faculty members will be supported with generous start-up packages, excellent laboratory space, access to laboratory animal facilities (including ABSL3), and a wide range of state-of-the-art core facilities providing services in genomics, proteomics, bioinformatics, cell imaging, flow cytometry, and pathology. Successful candidates are expected to initiate and maintain a vigorous, independent, extramurally funded research program, participate in the NYU School of Medicine graduate programs within the Sackler Institute and be eligible for membership in NIH-supported training programs that support pre- and post-doctoral trainees.

Candidates with an M.D. degree that are board eligible or board certified in Infectious Diseases will be given especially strong consideration

Are you interested in guiding key business decisions around one of Amazon’s significant and growing investments? Amazon Middle Mile is looking for an experienced, self-driven, analytical, and strategic Senior Business Intelligence Engineer. Amazon Middle Mile is focused on building solutions, applications and platforms that improve the scheduling and routing of trailers and trucks through the entirety of Amazon's fulfillment network between the Fulfillment Center (FC) and the Delivery Station (DS). The Middle Mile includes both research science and production software, applications and platforms. We are developing novel solutions that reduce cost, improve the customer experience and create new ways for us to monetize our transportation assets.

In this role, you will be exposed to what Amazon is doing to re-think the future of Amazon's ground & air transportation network. You will be working with a diverse, complex and very large data warehouse environment. You will work hand-in-hand with a Data Engineering (DE) team to build analytics pipelines, platforms and solutions that solve important business problems. Instead of drowning in Excel spreadsheets and tabs, you will be working with Tableau to build a self-service reporting and basic analytics solution. As a senior BIE, you will be focused on reporting and statistical analytics; you will have the support of a DE team who has the responsibility to build and maintain our physical data infrastructure and Middle Mile’s data model, which makes it far easier for the BI team to focus on their core competencies of reporting and statistical analytics. In this role, you will have ownership of the end-to-end development of solutions to complex questions and you’ll play an integral role in strategic decision-making.

The right candidate will possess excellent business and communication skills, be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions, and be able to analyze data to answer those questions. You should have a solid understanding of Tableau and an ability to use data for statistical analytics.
Basic Qualifications
BA/BS Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Bioinformatics or related discipline
5+ years of relevant experience with data mining, SQL, building reporting, and statistical modeling
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with business customers to drive requirements analysis
Proactive attitude
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast-paced environment where ambiguity is the norm
Demonstrated track record of creative problem solving; think big, start small, grow fast
Strong attention to detail, excellent organization skills, and ability to manage multiple projects and responsibilities
Experience with STATA, R, SAS or other statistical software packages
Experience in software development languages such as ruby, python or perl

Looking to grow your experience in a great company that is truly employee-centric? Here’s the opportunity to work with a great team with excellent growth potential! ATUM is looking for a new member for our Gene Synthesis Production and Mammalian Purification team.
ATUM is a world leading bioengineering company. The company has developed an integrated bioengineering pipeline for gene and protein design / optimization / manufacturing as well as unique proprietary platforms for protein and strain engineering. The pipeline relies on state-of-the-art Synthetic Biology and Machine Learning to provide custom made solutions for our customers, including large and small pharma and biotech, as well as agricultural and industrial biotech companies across the globe. ATUM is a 15 year old, heavily science driven company that currently employs ~100 people. For more information visit www.atum.bio
This entry-level position is within our production group. The work includes following standard operating procedures for using automated liquid handling stations, interfacing with our in-house database, providing support in various possible lab functions including PCR, making agarose gels, growing culture from stock, organizing/purging storage plates, purifying proteins, and interacting with our bioinformatics department.

…we want to talk to you!

Job Description:
The Forsyth Institute is dedicated to research and education in oral and related biomedical science. It offers a world-class working environment and the opportunity to participate in advanced, cutting-edge research. Located in Kendall Square, Forsyth is at the epicenter of the biotechnology sector and has fostered collaborations in both academia and industry. Forsyth is an affiliate of the Harvard Medical School and the Harvard School of Dental Medicine
The position is to support a collaborative team effort on the oral microbiome. The team is composed of Drs. Gary Borisy, Floyd Dewhirst and Jessica Mark Welch with Dr. Borisy serving as the lead investigator of the team.
The research will lay the groundwork for a comprehensive, metapangenomic analysis of the oral microbiome. It will include data mining, analysis and visualization of genomic and metagenomic sequence data. The project will augment the Human Oral Microbiome Database at the Forsyth Institute and serve as a unique resource to the oral community.

.

Required Experience:

The qualified candidate will have excellent computational and bioinformatics skills as well as sufficient background in microbiology to be able to work interactively and productively with the collaborative research team. A Bachelor's degree is essential and an advanced degree is welcome, but credentials are less important than the skill set and aptitude of the candidate. An in-depth knowledge of Python is desirable as well as experience with ‘omics in general and the information that can be derived from genome sequencing. The ability to work as a member of a team, to communicate effectively, to make group presentations and to write reports is essential. Resourcefulness, independence, strong motivation, excellent interpersonal skills, and the desire for continued learning are all important.


Please submit a full application, including a cover letter with a description of past research experience, a curriculum vitae, list of publications, the names of three references, and expected availability date to: Gary Borisy, PhD, The Forsyth Institute, 245 First St, Cambridge, MA 02142. Please send submissions via http://forsyth.atsondemand.com before December 1, 2018.

The Department of Environmental Health Sciences at the Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health seeks candidates for two Assistant Professor positions in Environmental Epigenetics and Epidemiology.

The incumbents will be named Assistant Professors at the Columbia University Medical Center, and will participate in the research and educational activities of the Laboratory of Environmental Precision Biosciences. The laboratory, directed by Dr. Andrea Baccarelli, conducts large-scale environmental epidemiology studies to investigate how exposure to environmental chemicals leads to human disease. The laboratory research portfolio includes DNA methylation and epigenetics studies, extracellular non-coding RNAs, mitochondrial DNA, and the human microbiome. The laboratory investigates a wide array of environmental exposures including air pollution, endocrine disrupting chemicals, flame retardants and others. The laboratory team includes both dry- and wet-lab personnel. The applicants will be expected to contribute to the ongoing and future research in the laboratory and to gradually develop an externally funded research portfolio. Some independent salary coverage from research projects will be required for the long-term success of the candidate. Educational duties comprise mentoring students, post-doctoral fellows, and course lecturing. Applicants must have a doctoral degree, post-doctoral experience, and excellent qualifications in research and education.

The Laboratory of Environmental Precision Biosciences occupies recently renovated space, designed to foster highly collaborative and innovative research and is highly integrated in the vibrant scientific community of the Columbia University Medical Center. Our department includes three NIH-funded environmental health centers, including the NIEHS Core Center for Environmental Health in Northern Manhattan, the Columbia Center for Children's Environmental Health, and the Columbia University Superfund Program. State-of-the art core facilities at the Columbia University Medical Center are an added attraction.

For a more complete description of our program, activities, and facilities, please see our laboratory and department websites.

Position #1 - Environmental Epigenetics (Wet-lab)
The successful applicant will have experience in the field of epigenetics and genomic regulation, utilizing a combination of genomic, genetic, molecular, or systems approaches in large-scale human studies. We are interested in outstanding wet-lab scientists with expertise in using cutting-edge technologies in large-scale human studies. Ideal candidates will have expertise in molecular epidemiology and previous experience in epidemiology studies.

Position #2 - Environmental and Molecular Epidemiology (Dry-lab)
The successful applicant will have expertise in environmental epidemiology with experience in biomarkers and/or molecular/genetic epidemiology studies. We are interested in outstanding scientists with expertise in environmental epidemiology. Ideal applicants will have a strong track record of research in environmental epidemiology, including experience in advanced data analysis. Experience with human molecular data is preferred, and experience in bioinformatics will be seen as advantageous.

Moffitt Cancer Center is internationally recognized for our focus on personalized cancer care and translational research. The mission of Moffitt is clear, focused, and fully stated in nine words, "To contribute to the prevention and cure of cancer." With a tradition of excellence that began with the first patient admission in 1986, dedicated Moffitt physicians, scientists, and staff members have remained committed to excellence in an atmosphere characterized by kindness, caring, and hope.

H. Lee Moffitt Cancer and Research Institute is a modern facility in Tampa, Florida. We strive to be the leader in understanding in the complexity of cancer through team science and applying those insights for human benefits. Be part of the cure by joining Moffitt's team of over 800 research faculty scientists, career staff scientists, postdocs, graduate students and support staff dedicated to cancer research.
